attributes.action: Water safety/drowning prevention & effects of cold water to be taught in schools
attributes.background: In 2016 we saw the launch of the first ever water safety strategy in the UK which aims to reduce water related fatalities by 50% by 2026. Collaboration, awareness, education and prevention are the main focuses.
attributes.additional_details: Like many others i learned the hard way my 1st born son lost his life swimming in open water aged 13. The 1st time I heard the words "cold water shock" was when I was looking up how my physically fit son could have died. I started visiting schools in my son's memory to teach the dangers in & around open water my son was not alone in not knowing the dangers in fact he was part of a majority. This needs to change water safety/ drowning prevention needs to be a part of our national curriculum now!

attributes.action: Give the Royal Forest of Dean an AONB (Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty)status
attributes.background:
The Forest of Dean, 'Britain's favourite Forest', should be acknowledged as an area of outstanding natural beauty. AONB is land protected by the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000. It protects the land to conserve and enhance its natural beauty.
Please help us protect this unique area.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite meeting ALL the official requirements and, the Wye Valley being AONB, the Forest of Dean has still not yet been given this crucial status that it deserves. 
The forest is home to a wealth of fungi, flora, fauna and wildlife, including rare species such as the Peregrine Falcon.
The Royal Forest of Dean has won many awards including being recently voted 'Britain’s Favourite Forest'. 
We strongly urge you to support this petition to ensure the protection of this unique and ancient area.

attributes.action: Ban greyhound racing, and all exports of dogs to any country including the eu
attributes.background: The greyhound racing industry is unable to regulate itself or stick to welfare restrictions. Injured dogs and those who do not make it to the races in the first place are abandoned or killed. Dogs exported abroad end up bred and/ or raced in countries with no welfare protection. Please end this.
attributes.additional_details: Please. Let's end this cruel and outdated industry now. Don't believe anyone who says there are strict welfare standards. They are not followed. Dogs are suffering here in the uk today. The dogs sent abroad, often via EU countries, to China, Pakistan etc, suffer even more. Make this a civilised country which protects those with no voice. Greyhounds and sighthounds are great companions. Racing is under 100 years old. It needs to stop now. Please.

attributes.action: Kids with allergies must have a right to eat safe food from home at eateries.
attributes.background: We were recently humiliated and almost refused service when we brought home made food for our son, who has life threatening allergies, to a play centre. We believe that this is a form of discrimination. Parents should have the right to provide safe food for their children without being shamed.
attributes.additional_details: Since my experience, I have discovered many other similar stories where parents are publicly shamed. We are an invisible group who are discriminated against but have no protection under the law. We would like to enjoy going out as a family knowing that our children are safe.

attributes.action: Parliament debate whether Israel has 'improper influence' over British Politics
attributes.background: Theresa May has 'rejected' calls, from the leader of the opposition party, for a public inquiry, into alleged 'improper influences' in British politics by Israel. This is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: An investigation revealed plots by the Israeli diplomat to destroy the careers of numerous senior politicians. It is only on the basis of an investigation that Parliament and the British public will be reassured that such activities will not be tolerated by ANY British government. Therefore, and due to the Mrs May's outright rejection of a public inquiry into the matter, I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether Israel has improper influence over British politics.

attributes.action: Reverse the changes to allow for Textiles & Technology to be stand alone GCSEs.
attributes.background: Last year we saw the Government remove the individualised GCSE in Textiles, instead combining all of the technologies into a generalised technology GCSE.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this directly suppressing each of the material areas, but it is now narrowing the amount of pupils going into this field, and not enabling them to gain the breadth of skills they previously would have, which would allow them to move on to higher education. From the clothes on our back, to the modern materials found in protective uniform such as Kevlar, we surrounded by technology, and it is vital that ALL areas are widely available to all pupils in the UK

attributes.action: The EU referendum result must be dismissed as not fit for purpose
attributes.background: On its own admission, the government should have included a double majority as a criterion for implementing the EU referendum result. In 2015 in a debate on an SNP amendment requiring this and other safeguards, David Lidington stated that these were not necessary as the referendum was advisory only.
attributes.additional_details: The obvious conclusion we can draw from this is that the government believed that a binding referendum would require these checks and balances. David Cameron then proceeded to change the status of the referendum to binding by promising to implement the result but failed to change the majority criteria. We do not believe that a 3.8% majority, after a shameful campaign, is a mandate for such a huge constitutional change, nor the dismissal of 48% of the electorate, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

attributes.action: The holiday  homes industry to have tighter, stricter regulations.
attributes.background: The holiday homes industry to have tighter, strict regulations to safeguard customers losing money. These regulations to safeguard owners in a similar way that the park homes are protected.

attributes.action: Stop the Iraq Fatality Investigations (IFI).
attributes.background: The Iraq Fatalities Investigations were set up by the MoD to look into allegations made against UK armed forces personnel in Iraq.  Many of these allegations have been investigated several times already, placing intolerable strain on soldiers and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, Major Robert Campbell has already been investigated seven times for an incident alleged to have occurred in Iraq 2003. Each time there has been no case to answer.

Having spent his entire career helping others, providing water and shelter as a Royal Engineer and clearing mines, IEDs and bombs as a Bomb Disposal Officer he deserves better.

As he reaches retirement from the Service as a disabled Servicemen, he is now threatened with another investigation.  This must stop.

attributes.action: Stop development on Green Belt land and prevent de-designation of Green Belt.
attributes.background: We call upon Parliament to fully support measures to stop development on green belt land and to prevent de-designation of green belt land, to halt the coalescence of villages such as Kings Langley into neighbouring towns thus permanently losing their character.
attributes.additional_details: Green Belt is under increasing threat and it is time to say 'enough' - no more building on precious open spaces between towns and villages because it is irreplaceable.  There are other places to build than on the Green Belt - keep it untouched for the generations to follow.

attributes.action: Make parking of ICE vehicles at EV charging points a more serious offence
attributes.background: Dedicated charging points for EV across the country are regularly and deliberately occupied by conventional ICE vehicles. This causes unnecessary stress for EV drivers as, unlike conventional cars, electric vehicles require charging points and attached parking place to be able to move.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, there are more than 100k plug-in vehicles in the UK. These cars require charging points to be able to move and in most cases such points are placed within parking areas for conventional cars. Although clearly marked as such, many of the points are obstructed by ICE vehicles, deliberately parking in EV-dedicated slots. This became a chronic symptom across the country and causes unnecessary stress for drivers. Local councils are not doing enough to protect rights of EV community.

attributes.action: Introduce proper effective regulation of implantable medical devices
attributes.background:
Repeated scandals involving medical devices show that the current regulatory system is not fit for purpose
Tighten regulation of medical devices so that:
- High risk medical devices have clinical trial evidence at the time of approval
- There is a publicly accessible registry for such devices
attributes.additional_details:
There have been multiple scandals over implanted medical devices, including pacemakers, TVT meshes, breast implants, & metal hip joints.

Current rules mean manufacturers don't have to produce clinical trial evidence before CE safety marking & use in patients. Equivalence allows a new device to be waved through if a manufacturer declares it similar to an existing product, even if those other products have had safety concerns.

Reference: BMJ Open 2017;7:e017125
doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017125

attributes.action: Maximum 30 day wait for anyone needing counselling for mental health issues
attributes.background: As someone who has battled mental health issues for the last 20 years. I’m sick of going to my G.P. and being told there’s a minimum 3 month waiting list. This isn’t good enough. I’m requesting that a maximum wait of 30 days be instilled.
attributes.additional_details:
It is wrong that depending on where you live, decides how quickly you receive NHS support for mental health. It is grossly under funded and massively under resourced.
5 times in the last 10 years I have been told there is a minimum 3 month wait for help, this is in the Richmond (York’s) constituency, one of the wealthiest in the country.
So I want a maximum 30 day wait.

attributes.action: Have a national two minute silence on May 22 at 11am for the Manchester victims
attributes.background: We would like to create a two minute silence nationally in remembrance of the 22 who tragically lost their lives in the Manchester arena bombing last May. We need as much help as possible to raise awareness and show the world that love wins- always.

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to the Metropolitan Police budget
attributes.background:
Having lost £600 million in real terms over the past 7 years, the Metropolitan Police face a further £400 million cut over the next 4 years.

70 per cent of all police spending in London comes from the Home Office, meaning that any change in that funding has a disproportionate effect.

attributes.action: Release the 'Implementation Unit Report on Shale Gas' (2016) immediately.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand that the above report is published unredacted to allow full scrutiny of all relevant issues by The Communities and Local Government (CLG) Select Committee inquiry into fracking, and to inform the public consultation on the draft National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).
attributes.additional_details: In response to FOI requests by Sir Kevin Barron MP for this secret report to be made public, the Cabinet Office acknowledged that “decisions ministers make regarding fracking may have a significant impact on the lives of citizens.” However, the government refuse to publish this report on the grounds that doing so “could call into question the industry’s viability." We believe the public has a right to know what the government is withholding from the public. Read more here: https://goo.gl/Wbsg1r

attributes.action: Licence the use of Air Rifles
attributes.background:
Swan Support 
We are a swan rescue organisation who rescue sick and injured swans within the Thames Valley and surrounding areas.The calls relating to swans that have been shot with air rifles has increased exponentially in recent months.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like air rifle ownership to become a licensed requirement, resulting in a more severe penalty for misuse or use without a valid license.Swans mate for life, so when one is lost to this barbaric and torturous tactic the mate and offspring do not thrive.Swans are an important species in naturally balancing our eco-system by playing a vital role in keeping our wild areas viable & enriched.We, (and the swans), would truly value your support in helping reduce this heinous practice.
Thank You

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions to STOP anonymous, false & malicious complaints to Ofsted.
attributes.background:
For too long those in the education & care sector have been at the mercy of disgruntled employees and/or families who are able to make anonymous, malicious & false complaints to Ofsted. 
The impact can be detrimental to the organisation involved & is costing the UK tax payer unnecessarily.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact on the organisation can be detrimental if the malicious complaint becomes public. Resulting in a tarnished reputation and/or closure of a service in come instances.

We are petitioning for Ofsted & the Government to introduce fines to those making false & malicious complaints. 
This means no more anonymous complaints can be received. 

This change will safeguard organisations, save money & help tighten up Ofsted's complaints procedures.

attributes.action: The Scottish Government should be called the Scottish Executive.
attributes.background: The description of Scotland's devolved administration as a 'Government' causes confusion about its constitutional remit, which has led to considerable over-reach by devolved bodies into reserved matters. This duplication is contentious, costly, and detracts from the good governance of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: We petition Parliament to repeal section 12 of the Scotland Act 2012.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement of law to label all Halal certified products as such.
attributes.background: Many products that are Halal certified fail to carry the logo that informs people. We, as non-Muslims, feel that it should be a legal requirement for companies to label products as such, which gives us a choice on whether to buy that product or choose a non-certified option.
attributes.additional_details: The list that was on a particular certification website has been removed following a revamp. This information should be available readily.

attributes.action: Correct the flaws in our First-Past-The-Post voting system.
attributes.background:
Add score voting to the FPTP ballot; to correct its flaws, improve on its ability to produce strong governments, and strengthen its direct constituency link

Stand by 2011 AV referendum result by keeping the first past the post selection of MPs defining FPTP, but address the issues that lead to it
attributes.additional_details:
FPTP Currently: a voter marks one candidate, voters' marks are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

W/ Score Voting: a voter scores each candidate, voters' scores are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

A minor ballot change can fix all of FPTP's flaws AND add to its strengths

Simple guide: endfptp.reddit.com/6xtbgh

Comprehensive guide: rangevoting.org

2017 GE Simulated w/ Score voting: endfptp.reddit.com/6lctda

Score vs. PR: endfptp.reddit.com/6gur0e

attributes.action: Introduce an animal abuser registry in the UK
attributes.background: Animal abuse should be recorded in a database similar to ViSOR, in the UK. A registry should be introduced that records the name, date of birth, offence, conviction date and expiration date of all known animal abusers, preventing them from adopting a pet or working with animals in any capacity.
attributes.additional_details: There is a strong correlation between animal abuse and domestic violence between humans. Furthermore, there are countless recorded cases of serial killers having tortured animals before moving onto crimes against humans. With this in mind, the registry would not only protect animals and pets from abuse, but also, potentially, humans. The USA is already taking steps to enforce these laws in several areas, although Tennessee is the only place to implement a state-wide registry.

attributes.action: Change immigration Rules and accept full time study in UK as proof of English
attributes.background: My son is 18 years old and has 7 years of full time study in UK. He is first year at University now and has ABBBB in Higher Mathematics,English,Physics,Chemistry and Biology.His application for British Citizenship has being refused because had No prove of Speaking and Understanding English Language.
attributes.additional_details: Please help our immigrant children, who have being taught in English and have learned the British values, not to be humiliated and accept their years of study in this country as proof of English. After seven years of study in the United Kingdom it is unacceptable to be asked to give one more test to prove they can speak and understand the English language. Please sign this petition to change this abusive rule and help our children. Thank you for taking your time to read my petition.

attributes.action: Proscribe Britain First
attributes.background: Britain First are an ultra far right group, they have a paramilitary wing called the "Britain First Defence Force". They organise ‘days of action’ that target a specific demographic namely Muslims, they use these days of actions to harass Muslims in shops, on the street or in mosques.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of its campaigners have also been banned from every mosque in England and Wales for their actions.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/britain-first-banned-from-all-mosques-in-england-and-wales-after-police-take-out-injunction-a7196831.html

attributes.action: Introduce seller identity check and records of item for cash for gold shops
attributes.background:
There have been nationwide burglaries targeting Asian families perceived due to Asian families having Gold in their houses.
The burglaries can be life threatening.
Police have difficulty in finding the stolen items and as gold can be cashed in easily after melting.
attributes.additional_details:
Asian families are seen to be targeted for gold in their homes.
New controls be put in place to oblige the buyers of gold for cash to establish the identity of the seller, information of the source of the object, a requirement to retain the item at the outlet and to record the transaction, as well as provide police with access to items and records.
Police should be given  adequate powers of access, questioning, 
arrest .

There are similar laws in Australia and Ireland .

attributes.action: Make General Practice recognised as a specialism in the UK
attributes.background: General practice is the foundation of the NHS, yet even though doctors undergo rigorous training to become a GP, including an exit exam (MRCGP) they are still not recognised as specialists. The UK is an outlier compared to other countries across the globe.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently UEMO (the European Union of General Practitioners/Family Physicians) called for all European countries to recognise the speciality and the statement has the support of other European 
medical organisations.

In August 2016 the RCGP released this press statement http://www.rcgp.org.uk/news/2016/august/gps-must-be-recognised-as-specialists-in-general-practice-say-rcgp-and-the-bma.aspx , but to date there continues to be no movement on their call.

attributes.action: Save our pets from death on the roads Don't Ban Containment Systems
attributes.background: The Government has started a consultation on banning electronic training aids for cats and dogs. It is vital that containment systems do not get caught up in any ban. These systems save the lives of thousands of cats and dogs each year. Over 250,000 cats & countless dogs are run over on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: In 2007 DEFRA commissioned a study into the use of Electronic Pulse Training Aids. This study specifically excluded containment fences. The highly regarded Companion Animal Welfare Council's in-depth study of June 2012 concluded that it was not possible to formulate an evidence-based argument against the use of Electric Pulse Training Aids (EPTAs). In 2016 research from Lincoln University into cat containment "No evidence of long-term welfare problems with electronic containment of cats"

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to offer a Vegan option in KS1 free school meals.
attributes.background: Currently schools will provide meals for children, who are following vegetarian diets, have allergies and avoid foods due to faith, but they do not provide a Vegan option and some Children who wish to follow a vegan diet are not able to. It should be law that schools provide vegan options.
attributes.additional_details: Some schools will accommodate and adjust meals for vegan children, this is not standard in all schools and some parents are told to provide packed lunches, Schools will provide a vegetarian and meat option, excluding vegan children from participating in school dinners. Children should have the choice to be able to choose a vegan option on the menu, everyday. No child should ever feel left out because of a life choice they have made, veganism should be widely accessible to all children.

attributes.action: Clarify the term "Railway Land" of the Lynn and Fakenham Railway Acts 1876/81
attributes.background: The Whitwell & Reepham Railway Preservation Society are a Heritage Railway and have been running for over 10 years. We would like to relay track on an old track bed running from Whitwell & Reepham Station to Lenwade Station, making sure the existing users can still use the land as well.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the Government to
1) clarify the position of the Lynn and Fakenham Railway Act of 1876 to 1881, the Eastern & Midlands Act 1883 to 1885, and the other railway almaganations up to Network Rail times, and to confirm the land under the Lynn and Fakenham Act still does in fact have an act of parliament still in force for the land to be used as a railway
2) clarify who actually has preference over this land if the point above is true.
3) Provide us with a written statement of the above

attributes.action: Reduce the content covered at GCSE History so that only 3 Units are studied.
attributes.background: The new History GCSE only caters for the higher ability students and covers over 1200 years of study. There is far too much to cover to do any of the topics justice, regardless of exam board. A limit of 3 units of study needs to be imposed to ensure these units can be taught effectively.

attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Change the law so that rape can be classed as a terrorist offence
attributes.background: Targeting women & children with the heinous act of rape based on race, colour or religious, non religious & political beliefs, is a conscious form of illicit psychological warfare, genocide, &/or so-called ethnic cleansing as recognised by the UN Security Council under the 1820 resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
Amnesty International reports that all around the world military commanders are using rape to 'terrorize' humiliate and demoralize communities. Amnesty International, OHCHR, UNICEF, Military Chiefs, Govts all understand and know this undeniable fact.

These same tactics are being used in the UK. We need to recognise and understand that these are acts of terrorism.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that new borns have a heart scan before leaving hospital
attributes.background: Lots of new born babies are sent home from hospital with serious heart problems, which, are not known about until it’s too late. My youngest son was sent home with heart defects which were not picked up until he was two weeks old & required surgery almost immediately. This could’ve been prevented.
attributes.additional_details: When we were in the specialist heart hospital, there were many children coming in, with a late diagnosis. This can be very fatal and stressful. We didn’t know anything about the heart so we had to learn about this too. Having a heart scan like an echo would detect any problems or issues. The faster it’s picked up, the better. Specialists can be involved straight away with the correct care needed. An echo will take 15 mins. I would rather spend 15 mins extra knowing my child’s heart was healthy.

attributes.action: Stop explosive housing growth without infrastructure to support it
attributes.background: We call on the government to: (a) change planning laws and emphasis so that adequate infrastructure has to be provided alongside new homes; (b) provide grant funding where developer contributions alone are not enough to build new schools and health centres and improve the roads.
attributes.additional_details: This government is determined to build houses. It’s a free-for-all where councils don’t have a 5 year supply of housing land. Green fields around communities outside the green belt are targeted by developers. Local resources are overwhelmed, villages swamped. Country roads and junctions can’t cope. Growth should be spread evenly across council areas to avoid disproportionate impact, not concentrated in a few villages. Petition raised by East Leake in Rushcliffe but happening elsewhere too.

attributes.action: Make access to habitable shelter a protected and inalienable human right
attributes.background:
The homeless crisis in the UK is not caused by a lack of housing, but by access to housing being denied to homeless people.
We demand that access to habitable shelter be recognised as a human right, so that action can be taken to end homelessness immediately - with no one left out.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Shelter, over 300,000 people are homeless in the UK - in temporary accommodation, sleeping on the streets or in cars.
There are over 200,000 long-term empty homes in the UK (www.emptyhomes.com/assets/2017-10-17-empty-homes-press-release.pdf).
Even with just 2 bedrooms per home, that's enough to house everyone and end homelessness immediately.
However, since the right to own empty properties and second homes beats other people's rights to a home, access to those homes is denied.

attributes.action: Introduce photo ID cards in order to vote in all Elections.
attributes.background:
We believe that photo ID cards should be mandatory in order to be able to vote in all Elections.
In order to prevent voter fraud, the Government should introduce a national photo ID scheme. 
Government would pay for the ID cards. 
This would mean the cards would be free to any voter.
attributes.additional_details: The application form would be available to complete on  the Government website.

attributes.action: Regulate animal rescue centres.
attributes.background:
Animal rescue centres are currently not regulated. This means that anyone can open as a rescue centre.
 
Regulation would allow for rules and guidelines to be issued and regular visits made to inspect that there is at minimum no breach of the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Do extra checks in scans during pregnancy to check for vasa previa placentas.
attributes.background: Vasa previa placentas are rare 1:2500 pregnant women have them therefore they do not check for them as standard however detected before labour mum and baby have 99% chance of survival. Undetected if mum goes into labour baby's chance of NOT surviving is between 55-95%.
attributes.additional_details: This is when the vessels that feed the baby oxygen are on the outside of the placenta so when mum dilates and baby's head moves down the vessels burst starving baby of oxygen (with 2mins to get baby out) and causing mum to haemorrhage. Detected, mum will be hospitalised from 29 weeks and have a c section between 35-36 weeks. Undetected results can be devastating. A few extra minutes on a scan could save mum and baby's life.

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: Make Transplant patients Exempt from paying prescription charges
attributes.background: I have recently learnt after going to renew my exemption certificate that Transplant patients are not exempt despite the amount of drugs they have to take for this life threatening illness. I feel this is wrong when other illnesses such as diabetes are exempt.

attributes.action: Make our NHS hospital wards and waiting rooms across the UK infertile friendly.
attributes.background: There are 3.5m people affected by infertility in the UK. Yet their experience of our hospitals & surgeries only add to their grief and pain. Women who have suffered miscarriage, hysterectomies, gynae operations etc are placed in maternity wards/waiting rooms surrounded by pregnant women & babies.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking for:
•  Separate rooms where women can wait for appointments away from pregnant women, babies and pregnancy poster campaigns 
•  Separate wards for women miscarrying their babies away from pregnant women, babies and maternity wards
•  Separate rooms or wards for young women having had hysterectomies away from early pregnancy departments or maternity wards
•  New legislation that means all NHS departments and GP surgeries provide safe environments for the infertile

attributes.action: We ask the Government to commit to the UK's continued participation in Erasmus
attributes.background: Questions have been raised about the UK's continued involvement in Erasmus because of Brexit. The Government should provide immediate clarity and commit now to seeking continued and full UK participation in Erasmus.
attributes.additional_details:
Questions have been raised about the UK's continued involvement in Erasmus because of Brexit, see various press articles: 
https://www.timeshighereducation.com/blog/uk-students-may-be-barred-erasmus-after-brexit 
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/feb/07/a-students-plea-to-brexit-negotiators-keep-the-erasmus-scheme 

Erasmus opportunities should be available for future generations.

attributes.action: Dogs under S1 DDA should automatically be entitled to interim exemption
attributes.background: The Dangerous Dogs Act (s1) prohibits ownership of certain dogs. Any dog suspected to be a banned breed it is likely to be seized by the police and kept in a police kennel. If the court finds the dog is a banned breed but it is not deemed a danger, it may be exempted (subject to restrictions).
attributes.additional_details: The police have the power to issue an interim exemption pending the courts decision. However, this is entirely at their discretion and how this is dealt with varies between forces. Where a dog is only being pursued as a result of how they look, this interim exemption should be automatic (where the restrictions can be put in place and adhered to). Spending long periods in kennels can detrimental to the welfare of a dog and the owner.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live small animals in pet shops and garden centres in the UK
attributes.background: Shops should no longer be allowed to sell living creatures. It is too easy for people to make rash decisions & impulse buy animals when they're displayed like products. If the animals weren't on display, people would have to do more research & seek out a breeder or rescue for their new pet.
attributes.additional_details: Animals sold in shops or garden centres are most at risk of abandonment or left to charities. When sold to anyone who can pay, this can result in unprepared, incompetent, or abusive owners. Often stored out of sight, these animals are kept in small crates with little space or care. Animals are often depressed, mis-sexed, sick, or injured.  Leading to unexpected litters & vet bills, while animals when bought for children or as a gift on a special occasion, are often given up or abandoned.

attributes.action: Make the wearing of cycle helmets for children law.
attributes.background: Wearing my cycle helmet saved my life! It protected my head when I hit the road and from the hot exhaust when I was trapped under the car. The helmet was amazing as it was damaged and melted but still intact. Now I want all children to have to wear helmets.
attributes.additional_details:
My accident happened while cycling to school. I came off my bike head first, landing in front of a car, which drove over me, trapping me beneath. The air ambulance attended and I was flown to hospital. I sustained three breaks, a fracture and lost some teeth. 

The consultant said I wouldn't have survived without a helmet.  

I want you all to understand it can happen to anyone....as it happened to me!

attributes.action: Make the teaching of Sexual consent  compulsory In schools
attributes.background:
Rape, Sexual abuse and harassment are prevalent issues effecting our society. 

More needs to be done to tackle these issues. Children need to be taught what constitutes consentual sex and what actions are considered Sexual abuse and harassment as part of the compulsory national curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
The teaching of consent in schools is currently not compulsory. 

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence since. 

Some references:
https://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/09/sexual-consent-lessons-government-criticised-pshea-inadequate

attributes.action: Insist all supermarkets sell plastic free alternatives for all products sold
attributes.background: Our world is being destroyed by plastic, with up 90% of sea birds alone having been found to have plastic in their guts. We can only begin to imagine the devastation plastic is having on the rest of the marine life, including fish that end up on peoples plates.
attributes.additional_details: We are all responsible, yet I feel our supermarkets have a the biggest responsibility to save our world. I feel it should be a legal obligation that all supermarkets offer plastic free, eco friendly alternatives to ALL their products so shoppers are given choice. At present the only option in most supermarkets is plastic, plastic and more plastic. This HAS to stop. Please sign this petition to ask the government to make it a legal requirement that all supermarkets have plastic free alternatives.

attributes.action: Brexit: Stop using ‘will of the people’ and ‘will of the British people.’
attributes.background: Government ministers are perpetrating a falsehood when advancing its affairs as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘the will of the British people’; taking its authority to use these expressions from the result of the EU advisory referendum of June 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2016 referendum, the Electoral Commission recorded the following:
Total electorate: 46,500,001
Voted Leave : 17,410,742
Voted Remain: 16,141,241
Rejected Ballots: 25,350
On the basis of these figures, the government in expressing the will of 17,410,742 members of the electorate as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘ the will of the British people’ is publishing a falsity when 29,089,259 members of the electorate did NOT vote to leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Tongue Tie to be recognised and made a compulsory check on Newborn Babies.
attributes.background: Tongue Tie can affect around 4-11% of newborns and it's a malformation which restricts the movement of the tongue. It can cause difficulties from a young age and as they grow.  It can cause mothers issues around breastfeeding or terminate breastfeeding like in our case.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son is 15 weeks old had tongue tie up until very recently where we gave in and had a private consultation to have his Tongue Tie divided due to it causing him problems. His bibs were saturated, hasn't gained much weight, couldn't latch onto the teat and pooling milk in his mouth and not swallowing for several sucks. 
It can cause speech & dental problems and the inability to chew solid foods as well as emotional factors. It can cause mums problems like sore/cracked nipples, low milk supply and mastitis. Unfortunately it went unrecognised for 15 weeks in our case even though we pointed it out. It takes just a few seconds to snip and would potentially reduce the amount of appointments and referrals if dealt with early on.
Reference: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/tongue-tie/

attributes.action: NHS doctors and dentists should receive a payrise of at least 3% in 2018.
attributes.background: All NHS staff get a payrise of at least 6.5% (and up to 29%) over the next 3 years except doctors and dentists. Since 2008, doctors have experienced the largest drop in earnings of all professions, with consultants seeing a 19 per cent fall in pay, junior doctors 21 per cent and GPs 20 per cent.
attributes.additional_details:
The BMA said that doctors' pay should be increased in line with the wider economy, and it has called for the pay of all UK doctors to be increased in line with the RPI (Retail Price Index), plus £800 or 2 per cent, whichever is greater. (https://www.bma.org.uk/news/2018/february/bma-seeks-pay-rise-for-doctors-in-line-with-wider-economy).
In 2017-2018, the UK inflation rate has been about 3%. (https://tradingeconomics.com/united-kingdom/inflation-cpi)
